body:
Hi guys!
  Today, I got a bigger problem than always. My normal FPS were in Avicus like 9 or 7, very laggy. But yesterday I got 0 or 2 fps, so it is bad and worst.... 
What should I do? My PC is a HP Pavilion dv7 [Laptop]
It is very hot, I saw in speedfan that the CPU's are in 60 Celsius....
My PC specs:
Graphics card: Intel(HD) Graphics
Processor: Intel Core i7 @ 3.1 Ghz
RAM: 8 GB
O.S.: Windows 8.1 x64 bits
Please, Help! :C
body_tagged:

title: What should I do? [lag problem]

reply_to.body:
Ok
1. Open internet explorer 7 (it needs to be 7)
2. Go to this page. (http://avicus.net/forums/e77fbaa14)
3. Hit f5 about 40 times
4. Restart your computer
5. You should get around 1000 fps now
reply_to.body_tagged:

replies.body: From ur PC setup, you should be getting near 100fps.

replies.body: If your laptop is gettig quite hot I suggest you should look around and see if there are better fans out there. Because that seems to be your problem.

replies.body: Sorry, but you're quite wrong. He is using integrated graphics, so his performance is greatly hindered.

replies.body: Change the graphic card to a gaming brand. From your ram dedicate 3-4 gigs of ram.
replies.body_tagged: Change the graphic card to a gaming brand. From your ram dedicate 3-4 gigs of ram.

replies.body: Okay, thank you guys. I'm looking for buy a cooler but I don't know if sped money on it, this is expensive in my country and it may doesn't run fine. So, I've dedicated 4 GB of RAM since July, but it doesn't change my FPS.
